data.description:
Introduction & Problem statement:
 
Our project aims to establish a Regenerative Finance local node and hub in Tanzania, with a focus on sustainability and integration of disruptive technologies such as Web3 and Blockchain, all while empowering and onboarding more projects into ReFi. By combining innovative waste & sustainable management strategies with the transparency and security of blockchain technology, we intend to contribute to a more sustainable and regenerative future.
Tanzania, like ma...
data.title: ReFi Tanzania
ReFi Tanzania
data.description:
Our project aims to establish a Regenerative Finance local node and hub in Tanzania, with a focus on sustainability and integration of disruptive technologies such as Web3 and Blockchain, all while empowering and onboarding more projects into ReFi. By combining innovative waste & sustainable management strategies with the transparency and security of blockchain technology, we intend to contribute to a more sustainable and regenerative future.
Tanzania, like many other regions, faces significant challenges related to waste management and environmental degradation. Improper disposal of waste contributes to pollution, health hazards, and ecological damage. At the heart of it all, Waste pickers are the ones that do all the off-setting however face many challenges such as lack of resources, negative societal stigma, and most importantly exploitation in pay where they receive a mere $0.1 per kilogram of waste! Additionally, the lack of transparent financial systems often hinders sustainable development efforts. Our project addresses these issues by creating a waste regeneration system that not only reduces waste but also provides economic incentives through blockchain-powered finance mechanisms.
Furthermore, Tanzania's development index is closely tied to energy supply, and with the rapid depletion of non-renewable resources, an energy crisis looms. Over 95% of Tanzanian households rely on firewood and charcoal for cooking, revealing a significant market demand for cleaner energy sources.

Our project's core solution involves the establishment of an infrastructure for waste regeneration that enables incentivizing regenerators in the form of waste pickers, transforming waste materials into valuable resources and enabling different organizations and businesses to keep track of their impact. By leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Blockchain, dmrv and efficient recycling processes, we aim to minimize waste accumulation and its negative impact on the environment.
![DappFLow](https://bafybeieea4fzkjtckftgwmd7jln6vdjq5kgge5y7ratfcyqcaag6f2xjpi.ipfs.w3s.link/image1.png)

Furthermore, we integrate blockchain technology to ensure transparent tracking of waste transformation processes and provide financial and governance rewards to participants who contribute to the system.
Project Goals:
Environmental Regeneration: Reduce waste accumulation, minimize pollution, and promote sustainable resource management through the production and use of eco-products, solar micro-grids in the near future to ensure as much sustainability and climate friendly as possible.
Blockchain Integration & Onboarding to Web3: Implement a secure and transparent blockchain system to track waste regeneration processes, decentralized storage onboard waste pickers to web3 directly and incentivize participants and receive impact certificates.
Create a Regeneration hub for ReFi Tanzania - Create a safe space where regenerative projects can receive mentorship, support and guidance to provide real world solutions that impact our climate. Working hand in hand with the University of Dar es salaam. In the long-run we are looking to introduce our own Mini-round.
Community Engagement: Raise awareness about waste-related issues and involve local communities in waste management and regeneration efforts as well as how they can benefit from sustainable practices in the form of ecological credits, tokenizing of Real world Assets and much more.
Project Updates & Learnings
We have successfully facilitated not only the removal, but conversion of 1.3 Tonnes (HDPE + LDPE) waste into eco-pellets so far from landfills and beaches in Dar es salaam.
![On ground](https://bafybeifklur5acohdqmiubzhgt6zeiqgx4e3kw2r6rlvxkp2tanensuqq4.ipfs.w3s.link/image5.jpg)

We successfully set up our ReFi event last November 2023, as well as our monthly beach cleanup on 20 November including local stakeholders, government officials and sustainability enthusiasts. We are aiming for at least 5 Tonnes collected, and converted into eco-products. (https://x.com/refitanzania/status/1731617463542915283?s=46&t=hj2iETJ0AG45JhGdjSLNcg)
![wote](https://bafybeihu6db5rjpbapgcj5o6dzcnmplrmvy7kxkxmy34inb77sar5nqm7a.ipfs.w3s.link/image6.jpg)
Completed MVP for our carbon-backed NFT marketplace (https://chatafisha-marketplace.netlify.app) 

Completed MVP for our Waste pickers MVP dApp (https://chatafishaapp.web.app), where we have so far onboarded 5 waste collection points with 20 waste pickers to login their daily offsets on our MVP so far. Training them on financial inclusion, saving, local governance mechanisms as well as the importance of their work in the community.
![StakeHolders](https://bafybeifklur5acohdqmiubzhgt6zeiqgx4e3kw2r6rlvxkp2tanensuqq4.ipfs.w3s.link/image5.jpg)
Dispersed over 900$ to 4 waste collection points so far, almost doubling what they normally receive. (https://explorer.mainnet.near.org/transactions/AF9yubcNSAvKXihYQ5iMKM319JjLCESxMKXnyBj5A4JE)
What we are up to currently:
Improving our MVP to fit users feedback, such as personal dashboards for waste managers, introduce trust scores for waste pickers to enable micro-lending in the long-run
![DASH](https://bafybeicoh4i3znowyl4eehh3afjc6pcsuptm333ybcsf35a6mh6ihvx2ea.ipfs.w3s.link/image2.jpg)
Onboarding more waste pickers to log in their daily verified offset information
Building our gamified Impact to earn Carbon backed NFT marketplace to incentivize the proper collection and regeneration of waste all over. Metadata includes name, location, type of waste as well as amount.
Revamping our NFT marketplace with new UI/UX including third-party verification
![IMPACT](https://bafybeihlqsvbuudn7lwi4ei7qzv6qhrhtiqkdtk2usty3xuordjnmhlilu.ipfs.w3s.link/image4.png)
Research on production of Biochar from plastic we produce powered by solar micro-grids. Biochar enhances soil fertility, reduces carbon emissions, and minimizes environmental damage.
Creating content material to easily onboard local projects making a significant impact in climate to Web3, and Public good funding on Gitcoin. Including explanatory videos, how to create a Web3 wallet, project, and donate.
Budget & Allocation of funds:
Technology Development: $10,000 for revamping our dApp that will contain in-built sub wallets for waste pickers, track credit scores with blockchain integration.
Infrastructure & Plant: $20,000 for revamping waste regeneration facilities and community engagement centers.
Logistics for waste: $1,000 for reallocating the waste from collection points to recyclers.
Awareness Campaign & Events: $2,000 for educational workshops, awareness programs, and community training on public goods, web3 and the intersection of climate.
Call to Action:
We invite you to contribute to our mission of creating a more regenerative and sustainable future in Tanzania. By supporting our project, you will play a crucial role in addressing climate action & sustainable practices, waste management challenges, and fostering transparent financial systems. Your donation will have a lasting positive impact on the environment, local communities, and the overall well-being of the region. Together, we can drive meaningful change and lead the way towards a more sustainable and prosperous Tanzania!

data.title: GG19 - Climate Solutions

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

data.title: GG18 - Climate Round
data.description: Grants in this round are primarily focused on climate solutions (the group may do other work, but the grant proposal must be directly related to climate solutions). The projects are explicitly helping to reduce GHGs, and/or serve as an important core infrastructure for web3 climate solution

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

Our project was selected to be part of the [GG20 Celo Public Goods Climate Bonus Round](https://mirror.xyz/celopg.eth/McicejfzasLM0nD5HKNdPukgQHvVrRVT2GiFwwzf8AA).


### **Celo Claim:**

Your project has an existing live dApp that you intend to deploy on Celo within this year., Your project uses the Celo Network to coordinate its operations (such as cStable payments, a Celo SAFE, Celo Hypercerts etc...), Your project has organised events and meetups that support the Celo ecosystem.

Description: Our aim is to build a portal that aims to streamline the creation and issuance of carbon-backed NFTs, each meticulously designed to represent verified ecological impact credits. These NFTs will serve as tangible assets containing relevant metadata, capturing the essence of eco-conscious contributions and enabling individuals and organizations to not only offset their carbon footprint effectively but also transparently participate in sustainability.

Doc for deploying on Celo: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lcQAkiAyajQbjpIndRYYcyV5Ax0mTKYnFQRdpvR2wdE/edit

IRL events sponsored by Celo, going over ReFi, Celo & EBF Framework: https://x.com/ReFiTanzania/status/1731617463542915283

Celo Safe: celo:0xD6801262C2e51629D14E94c7C58eCB97f5512aea

- [dApp architechture.png](https://storage.tally.so/private/dApp-architechture.png?id=da00QN&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6ImRhMDBRTiIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTMyMzUxN30.uKXPevncQpA0R8vDCy5na1B3uDOBzq-4IkxJwdkwiKI&signature=2f75b6a06d5f9823a2793e0714422c6e2970ca9c2e85d7bfe460bd4791280dbd) [CHATAFISHA | Proof of impact NFT marketplace  copy.pdf](https://storage.tally.so/private/CHATAFISHA-Proof-of-impact-NFT-marketplace-copy.pdf?id=G9ppYz&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6Ikc5cHBZeiIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTMyMzUxN30.kfqm4VY3Wy_AY-WiNiUptyJ78WIACNqfp2lI-cCwqF8&signature=75a1a1447fc3f0aa0b577ee13acc5bf266c7efa344b43821e0cf9213189d49eb) -

data.description:
After research onground & findings, we are building a MVP tool for governance in marginalized communities and a tool to track decentralized lending and Liquidity pool distributions on Celo, settling payments with stablecoins. Washikadao is Swahili word for "Stakeholders".
Mock up: https://www.figma.com/proto/CV9PdaNGu3kCS9Qki8bXIY/washikaDAO?page-id=0%3A1&type=design&node-id=1-2&viewport=557%2C230%2C0.14&t=ML9pqsRvhBMsvukm-1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=1%3A2

data.description:
Deploy initial web2 app with simple UI UX for waste managers to use to record their waste pickers' daily offset information onchain. The info will be stored onchain, aggregated and the metadata will be minted as a carbon-backed NFT. The dApp will be for collecting information & findings mostly. There will be another Carbon-backed NFT platform/marketplace that will display the aggregated 'Impact certificates' from these waste centers.

Doc for deploying: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lcQAkiAyajQbjpIndRYYcyV5Ax0mTKYnFQRdpvR2wdE/edit

Initial web2 app: https://chatafishaapp.web.app
data.title: Initial MVP for recording waste & Waste pickers offsets onchain

data.reason:
Our v1 is ready and available at http://chatafishaapp.web.app

Waste managers can register their centers, add and remove pickers, log in daily data of offsets, daily sales as well as export data as csv files. We are currently working on the v2 where they will also be a public dashboard for all to view. At the moment the dashboards are only visible to waste managers.

Our v1 is ready and available at http://chatafishaapp.web.app

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Key Active Goals, Plans, Objectives, and Milestones for ReFi Tanzania (2024-2025)
1. Scaling Community-Driven Regenerative Finance (ReFi) with WashikaDAO
Launch and Expansion of WashikaDAO: Deploy a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol to support community-led savings and lending, ensuring access to climate-resilient financial services for marginalized communities.

Pilot Climate Risk Financing: Implement a decentralized emergency fund using stablecoins for anticipatory action in disaster-prone regions, ensuring rapid aid distribution. This includes pilot with The SOlar Foundation on Solar saving circles.

Community Engagement & Education: Conduct workshops and onboarding sessions to introduce local waste pickers, cooperatives, and circular economy actors to decentralized funding mechanisms.

2. Advancing Circular Economy with Pyrolysis for Waste-to-Fuel Conversion
Pilot Pyrolysis Technology: Develop and deploy a small-scale pyrolysis plant to convert plastic waste into usable fuel (diesel, biochar, and syngas), reducing landfill waste and providing alternative energy sources.

Establish Collection Networks: Collaborate with local waste-picking communities to streamline plastic waste collection and processing, incentivizing participation through tokenized rewards and transparent payments.

Regulatory Compliance & Carbon Credit Exploration: Work with policymakers to establish legal pathways for scaling pyrolysis-based fuel production while exploring carbon credit mechanisms to support long-term sustainability.

3. Regenerative Energy Solutions: Coconut Shell to Bioenergy Initiative
Develop Bioenergy Production Sites: Convert discarded coconut shells into biochar and briquettes as a sustainable energy source, reducing reliance on deforestation-driven charcoal production.

Integration with WashikaDAO: Establish a DeFi-powered marketplace where small-scale energy producers can trade bioenergy assets and access microloans for scaling production.

Expand Community Participation: Train local cooperatives and entrepreneurs in coconut shell processing, enabling decentralized energy production and distribution.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoins backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

data.title: ReFi DAO Local Node - Gitcoin Beta Round

data.name: Refi DAO
data.description: Refi DAO

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation:
We utilize our SAFE on Celo for operations. We are also building our governance framework for these marginalized and savings communities on Celo making the user experience as friendly as possible by mapping their wallets in the backend to their mobile phone numbers and linking their National IDs. This will also enable tracking of history and records.
We will also be streamlining alternative financing via DeFi protocols on Celo for these marginalized communities.

Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF.
